title: Screen Time Health Intelligence App

requirements.text: Create a Motoko backend actor that stores per-user health metrics and screen time data. Expose query and update methods for saving and retrieving risk scores and simulated usage data, keyed by user principal.

quotes: All data is simulated - no backend needed

acceptanceCriteria: Backend actor compiles without errors
Actor exposes at least a stable data store and query/update methods for user risk profiles

requirements.text: Implement Internet Identity authentication (using the existing useInternetIdentity hook) as the login mechanism. Display a centered login screen with the app title 'Screen Time Health Intelligence', subtitle 'AI-powered behavioral risk prediction for burnout & fatigue', and a prominent login button. Show a card-style design with a deep blue gradient background.

quotes: Subtitle: "AI-powered behavioral risk prediction for burnout & fatigue"

acceptanceCriteria: Login screen renders centered on a deep blue gradient background (#1e3c72 to #2a5298)
Title 'Screen Time Health Intelligence' and subtitle are visible
Clicking the login button triggers Internet Identity authentication
After successful login, user is redirected to the Dashboard
If not authenticated, only the login screen is shown

requirements.text: Build a full-featured Dashboard page accessible only when authenticated. Include: (1) a top navbar with the app name on the left and user identity info plus a logout button on the right; (2) a welcome section showing 'Welcome back, {identity}' and the user's principal; (3) four metric cards (Burnout Risk, Eye Strain Risk, Sleep Disruption, Overall Health Score) with color-coded left borders and large percentage values; (4) deterministic risk score generation based on a hash of the user's principal string using the formula: burnout = 45 + (hash % 40), eyeStrain = 50 + (hash % 35), sleepDisruption = 30 + (hash % 45), healthScore = 100 - (40 + (hash % 30)); (5) trend indicators on each metric card.

quotes: Generate scores based on user's email hash

acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard is only accessible when the user is authenticated
Navbar displays app name and a functional logout button
Four metric cards display risk scores derived deterministically from the user principal hash
Each card has a distinct color-coded left border (red/orange, yellow, blue, green)
Scores remain consistent across page reloads for the same user

requirements.text: Add a Line Chart on the Dashboard titled 'Screen Time vs Burnout Risk (Last 7 Days)' using react-chartjs-2 and Chart.js. Register all required Chart.js components (CategoryScale, LinearScale, PointElement, LineElement, BarElement, Title, Tooltip, Legend). The chart must show two datasets: Screen Time (hours) and Burnout Risk (%), with labels Mon–Sun and realistic simulated data.

quotes: Screen Time vs Burnout Risk (Last 7 Days)

acceptanceCriteria: Line chart renders without errors
Both datasets (Screen Time and Burnout Risk) are visible with distinct colors
X-axis labels show Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat, Sun
Chart is displayed inside a white card with a shadow

requirements.text: Add a Bar Chart on the Dashboard titled 'Daily App Usage Breakdown' using react-chartjs-2. Show five categories: Social Media, Work Apps, Entertainment, News, Health Apps with colorful bars representing hours per day (simulated data). Display inside a white card.

quotes: Categories: Social Media, Work Apps, Entertainment, News, Health Apps

acceptanceCriteria: Bar chart renders without errors
All five categories are represented with distinct bar colors
Chart is placed in a white card with shadow below the line chart

requirements.text: Add a Risk Analysis section on the Dashboard with two columns: 'Risk Factors Detected' (with warning icons) listing: Late night usage detected, Extended continuous sessions, High social media ratio, Insufficient break intervals; and 'Recommendations' (with checkmark icons) listing: Take 20-20-20 eye breaks, Limit screens after 9 PM, Use app timers for social media, Enable night mode after sunset. Style risk factors in a red-tinted card and recommendations in a green-tinted card.

quotes: Risk factors: Late night usage detected

acceptanceCriteria: Two-column risk analysis section renders below the charts
Risk factors column has a red-tinted background and warning icons
Recommendations column has a green-tinted background and checkmark icons
All four risk factors and four recommendations are listed

requirements.text: Apply a professional, hackathon-ready visual theme across the entire app: deep blue gradient (#1e3c72 to #2a5298) for the header/navbar, white cards with subtle box shadows, orange accent color (#ff7a18) for CTAs and highlights, clean system font typography, responsive grid layouts for metric cards, smooth hover transitions on cards, and consistent spacing throughout.

quotes: Color scheme: Deep blue gradient (#1e3c72 to #2a5298)

acceptanceCriteria: Header/navbar uses the deep blue gradient
Metric cards have hover transitions and colored left borders
Orange accent is used on primary buttons and highlights
Layout is responsive and does not break on common screen sizes
Overall appearance is polished and presentation-ready

constraints: Use Internet Identity (existing useInternetIdentity hook) instead of Firebase Google Auth — Firebase is not supported on this platform
All Motoko logic must remain in the single backend/main.mo actor file
Do not edit any files under frontend/src/hooks/ or frontend/src/components/ui
Do not use Firebase, external authentication providers, or cloud databases
Chart data must be fully simulated on the frontend — no external API calls
nonGoals: Real Firebase or Google Authentication integration
Real screen time data collection from device APIs
Backend persistence of chart/usage data (charts use frontend-only simulated data)
Mobile app or React Native version
Real AI/ML model for risk prediction

required: Screen time health app hero logo — a glowing shield icon with an eye and waveform motif on a deep blue background (logo-shield.dim_256x256.png)
